Command.SQL: select distinct schema from (select creator as "SCHEMA" from sysibm.systables union all select schema from sysibm.sysdatatypes union all select schema from sysibm.sysroutines union all select schema from sysibm.systriggers ) a
select * from sysibm.systables where creator = '${owner}' and name like '${table}' and type like '${type}'
select * from sysibm.syscolumns where tbcreator = '${owner}' and tbname = '${table}' order by colno

select distinct v.creator, v.name, v.check from sysibm.sysviews v join sysibm.systables t on v.creator = t.creator and v.name = t.name where t.type = '${type}' and v.creator = '${owner}' and v.name like '${view}' order by 1, 2, 3

statement

select * from sysibm.systriggers where schema = '${owner}' and seqno = 1

select text from sysibm.systriggers where schema = '${owner}' and name = '${name}' order by schema, name, seqno
select * from sysibm.sysindexes where creator = '${owner}' and tbname like '${tableName}' order by creator, name
select * from sysibm.syskeys where ixcreator = '${owner}' and ixname = '${name}' order by ixname, colseq

select * from sysibm.syspackage where creator = '${owner}' order by collid, name
